data.text: Thank *you*, @hughbon - you were a delight to interview and so generous with your time. The girls’ mum said they were beside themselves with excitement 🙏 https://t.co/aK0sHmzhSD
@SimonGuy64 @sturdyAlex I don’t think he’d be a very good waiter, either

@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow They then met when they were both working on cruise ships, and I suspect they gravitated towards one another because they had similar stories of loss and displacement. It’s a novel!

@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow Stop me if I’m going on, BUT both my mum and my dad, who didn’t know each other at the time, left the UK and lived itinerant lives for years. Both their families had been totally fractured/
@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow Exactly. I think it shaped my dad’s life, even though he managed to be happy eventually. But my god, he never romanticised it.

@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow (Btw his mum was Welsh! From Colwyn Bay. And he adored his evacuee “parents”, a Methodist preacher couple in Burnley. Anyway: little details!)

@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow Julie, you are so right. Both of my parents were evacuees. My dad was 4, and when he came back his mother, a nurse, had died. The idea that they idealised their experience is mad.
Can’t even say how wonderful it was to interview @AbiAbim. Her memoir is without a doubt one of my books of the year. What a privilege it was to talk to her https://t.co/RqiVNcvIxz

@hughbon @jotwis @camlitfest @jeffreykboakye @JDawsonwriter @BirdgirlUK @pulp2011 @RuthJonesNews @NewStatesman @sewknitcraft @RunnymedeTrust @BritishAcademy_ @StMarysSch Hugh! We’re on at 6pm and will make sure that the pub is primed for your arrival shortly after! Hugely looking forward.
@MissPotkin Honestly, was just a sling and ice and painkillers until it got better. Think I was lucky and it didn’t take too long. Rest as much as you can xxx
@MissPotkin Sending much love from a fellow rotator cuff sufferer who spent a night in A&E crying. Horrible, horrible xxx
@RobertHanks @camlitfest @BegumNadiya @kamilashamsie We will make it so! Do come if you can xx
@randallwrites When it's unpostponed come and see me! xxx
@randallwrites Dear Lee, Wait until you hear about Ireland, love Scotland
@estellecostanza @noblerotbar Will miss these, but perhaps it will be an end to @dannykellywords looking at what I've cooked and saying "did you see what Niven's got for dinner?"
@kamilashamsie K, we're ONLY talking about cricket, didn't the festival say? Shan't mention the book at all, except the crickety bits xxx
@TrudaSpruyt @camlitfest @BegumNadiya @kamilashamsie I am! Will be at the BG event!

@naomialderman Absolutely, to all of this.
The ever-furious ZsaZsa Kelly did this other night but with a glass of red wine. Booze, shards everywhere. Broom, dustpan, hoover out at ELEVEN PM. They are little bastards. https://t.co/VEzIw84bhh
@RuthWareWriter Last time had a deadline innit
@holly @jackiethedunn Also GOOD LUCK with the newbies. We are in awe of you here.

@holly @jackiethedunn Our oldest cat became blind a few months ago (not sure how old, because she was a stray). She has amazed us by her adaptability and ability to navigate (still goes in and out of the cat flap). Stroking and soft voices when she gets a bit nervous of the others or loud noises
@KatyaTaylor @samatlounge @SimonGuy64 @KitdeWaal Extremely tough on us ratatouille fans

@samatlounge @KitdeWaal God this is like when I discovered the truth about the aubergine

@icod YES. Might go back #treat
@icod JEALOUS. Was in Aldi looking for these and they didn’t have them. Upside, some cut-price ceramic lanterns.

@georgeisediting @SouthLondonGirl Oh my god George, salivating (chicken and leeks pot roasted with a gremolata, v nice but want yours/larb)
@Gargarin Oh god there’s my ma’s dripping pot!

@spikedonline @Tom_Slater_ The literary community hasn’t; hence a sold-out event in solidarity and appreciation, with a huge cast of writers and thinkers, at the British Library two weeks ago. 

(NB: The Satanic Verses didn’t win the Booker; it was shortlisted. Midnight’s Children did.)
@AStrickland165 @clarebot Tiny little powerhouses of atrocity! x

@clarebot My hyperviolent middle cat, enraged at the attention given to her elder (blind) and younger (affectionate, easy, sweet) siblings, has taken to knocking full wine glasses over. A step too far.
@nicolanovelist @samatlounge 💪💪💪👍
@BrianNolan1974 @talktoBOI Ha! I’m on Day 2 but will hang on in there!
@talktoBOI Will do.
@talktoBOI FYI, all notifications are enabled, caches cleared, operating systems up to date. The issue is not at my end! But I am getting nowhere, and it's costing me time and money.

@talktoBOI Yes, I get through too. They take me through the process, and it doesn't work - as I said first, activations/approvals don't arrive on mobile, or are rejected, even when the customer service agent is generating them, or when we delete the app and re-install it etc.
@talktoBOI Thanks Eve, but this is exactly what I've been doing. They have not been able to assist; we just go through the same procedure, which doesn't work. I honestly don't know what to do.
@talktoBOI That hasn't worked so far - I just keep being taken through the same process, which doesn't work. What do I do?

Additionally, because I can't approve online transactions via the app, I've had to make a purchase using a UK card, thereby incurring charges. Working time lost is in the hours. And I'm no nearer resolving the issue. Can you please help?

@talktoBOI Hi, I'm on day 2 of trying to activate 356 online: activation/approval codes don't arrive, or fail. I have spent hours on the phone to your helpline with no success, using all my mobile minutes allowance in the process. What do you suggest?
@samatlounge Also more books that are not total bollocks
@randallwrites @fivekingdoms All the birthday love, gorgeous Lee xxxxxx
@leahmclaren He will surely kill us before too long 😻
@Tiny_Camels 🐱 you may need to relax it for special occasions!
Roast chicken for the tea https://t.co/yhEnPpSTwU
@thestephmerritt I *do*, but what about them? xxx
(Yes, am tweeting out book events, because literature is your pal in the face of all this bullshit)

I do worry that people will think "decadent" means we're doing it in negligées while smoking party Sobranies, but I am nonetheless delighted to be interviewing these two fantastic writers 💃🍸 https://t.co/cpJXnROHCz
Slight fear that Colm will take out a restraining order when he sees me rushing to interview him again, but I can't help it. Join us! https://t.co/ddJ99H7WcW
@KitchenBee Much, much love to you, Bee; and I’m so glad you could be with your mother. Such a painful, but also precious, time. Take care xx

@randallwrites Because I WAS and I SHALL be again. And then I shall return to Manchester for one final night before returning home, a broken husk of a woman.

data.text: Please listen this week! The curator of this weekend’s Lviv BookForum joined us and was just fantastic. And you can watch all of the events via ⁦@hayfestival⁩  https://t.co/QMhwD7Gjsk
@clarebot wonderful news!!!!!

tweets.text: @dannykellywords @AlexClark3 Fantastic.  I suspected as much! ❤️ My lovely mum and I went on the QM2 to New York and had a ball. My favourite place: the library. Alex will add so much to the enjoyment with those talks. Have a great time #brideshead https://t.co/YwjfkXUVCB
@AlexClark3 Almost as good as at the Cambridge University Arms ?
@AlexClark3 @booksellercrow @RolandBates12 An early Xmas of your own!
@booksellercrow @RolandBates12 Lester Bowie has ‘Almost Christmas’.

This’ll be a tough winter. If you’re a carer/NHS worker, or you just need a pick-me-up/know someone who needs a pick-me-up, email willdeanforestauthor@gmail.com. You don’t need to give a reason, just an address. I’ll pick as many as I can & send out signed books from the forest. https://t.co/fIhtRj45rR

Thanks to @AlexClark3 and everyone who came to the @camlitfest event on Saturday, especially to Maya and Polina for bringing along these wonderful drawings of @paddingtonbear. Like him they found friendship in UK 🇬🇧🇺🇦 https://t.co/5Nr2rkRt5F
@sturdyAlex Wow. Quick peruse through that thread and LOADS to unpack in Lee's answers.

@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow Stop me if I’m going on, BUT both my mum and my dad, who didn’t know each other at the time, left the UK and lived itinerant lives for years. Both their families had been totally fractured/
@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow Exactly. I think it shaped my dad’s life, even though he managed to be happy eventually. But my god, he never romanticised it.
@AlexClark3 @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow That’s so sad Alex. So many lives changed. So many losses. I don’t know how people can think it was a better time

@JulieOwenMoylan @langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow Julie, you are so right. Both of my parents were evacuees. My dad was 4, and when he came back his mother, a nurse, had died. The idea that they idealised their experience is mad.
@langtrygirl @annettedittert @JamesHarrisNow She talked a lot about fear and rationing and endless queues. None of it with any nostalgia for a ‘better’ past.
2 women, tears & smiles in equal measure . ⁦@camlitfest⁩ gold from ⁦Abi Morgan & @AlexClark3⁩ https://t.co/TwhzwBfqGp

@jotwis @camlitfest @jeffreykboakye @JDawsonwriter @BirdgirlUK @pulp2011 @RuthJonesNews @AlexClark3 @NewStatesman @sewknitcraft @RunnymedeTrust @BritishAcademy_ @StMarysSch I sincerely hope it’s 6pm because I have every intention of being in a pub by 8.
@AlexClark3 Alex, how did they fix you? I need to be fixed by next Friday. :(
I am in literal agony right now probably three minutes away from crying. The only thing that’s keeping me going is a drunk woman in a polo neck trying to fellate an Alpen cereal bar.
@AlexClark3 @camlitfest @BegumNadiya @kamilashamsie Oh, good lord, I wasn't going to be around but my weekend away has been cancelled. I wonder if there are tickets still.
@AlexClark3 Ha ha ha ha. (I was supposed to be in Ireland today as it happens. Postponed.) xxx
Dear Scotland, Why so rainy? Yours, a resident.

Before it’s all over, you’re all want to know my last Twitter meal was the @noblerotbar annual Beaujolais dinner. Pierre Koffman cooking and the trotters were off the shit rack. The wine too… https://t.co/SboaXASmt0
@AlexClark3 Will you remember this time to ask me about important cricket things that have been happening (may be kinder not to)
@AlexClark3 @camlitfest @BegumNadiya @kamilashamsie Are you still there on Sunday?

Continuing to plug book events as the ship goes down, what else would I do? Here I am at @camlitfest, suitcase full of frocks and notes, ready to interview @BegumNadiya ❤️ and @kamilashamsie ❤️, ready for tomorrow, when I’ll be onstage with…
Be honest, when was the last time you cleaned out your crumb tray?! https://t.co/rWcCxXV7Sn

@holly @jackiethedunn Our oldest cat became blind a few months ago (not sure how old, because she was a stray). She has amazed us by her adaptability and ability to navigate (still goes in and out of the cat flap). Stroking and soft voices when she gets a bit nervous of the others or loud noises
@jackiethedunn Any tips you have would be very gratefully received! I've had a blind bird and a visually impaired cat, but not a blind cat
@samatlounge @SimonGuy64 @AlexClark3 @KitdeWaal Oh yeah!!
@AlexClark3 @samatlounge I had no idea about the aubergine!
@KitdeWaal @AlexClark3 @samatlounge wait till you find out about the taco...👀
@KitdeWaal No way. I’ve been using this at completely inappropriate times. 😱
@AlexClark3 Absolute unit 🥰
@AlexClark3 Shirley Jackson vibes. Must seek out her work.
@AlexClark3 Wow, never read, these look SO up my street. Thank you!
@AlexClark3 Adore Fremlin

Celia Fremlin is an insanely underrated master of domestic suspense. Between 1958 and 1994, she published 15 witty, elegant, unsettling novels that unflinchingly exposed the dark side of 20th century British domestic life. She deserves a far wider readership.
@AlexClark3 Is that kitty Kiki or have you taken in another furball?

urls.title: Charlotte Mendelson and Claire Powell - Belfast International Arts Festival
urls.description: The authors of two of 2022’s funniest novels about families join us in Belfast. Charlotte Mendelson’s The Exhibitionist is about ambition, art and the anxiety of balancing priorities.

tweets.text: Lucky Belfast, home of @BelfastFestival which will throb with extra greatness at 6pm tomorrow when @CharlotteMende1 & Claire Powell will be in conv. with @AlexClark3. 💥💥💥 https://t.co/IlmKP7q6Sr

A scholarship (including tuition fees and stipend) for Black Britons to study any course at Edinburgh University has been set up in the name of my late, great friend, the novelist Andrea Levy. More information in the link https://t.co/0xANERlLWd Please share. Good luck https://t.co/CuWUnhyJBN

urls.title: The Andrea Levy Scholarship
urls.description: The University of Edinburgh is privileged to offer scholarships to support Black African and Caribbean heritage applicants from socio-economically challenged backgrounds, made possible by a gift from the family of the late Andrea Levy.

tweets.text: Poured a small glass of red wine. Several sips in, a drowned blowfly emerges . Will I survive the night ?

@SouthLondonGirl Ooo!  We’ve got pals coming so it’s smoked eel toasts with drinks, then roast grouse, greens, spuds & vats of bread sauce followed by a cherry strudel.  Please to share your larb recipe.
I'm in 1976 duz tha want owt ? https://t.co/vS7kD6f8rZ

urls.title: We have betrayed Salman Rushdie once again
urls.description: Just two months on from the Islamist attempt on his life, everyone seems to have forgotten about it.

tweets.text:
Salman Rushdie has been left blind in one eye and unable to use one of his hands after the Islamist attempt on his life. And yet everyone seems to have forgotten about him. The elites have betrayed him again, just as they did in 1989, says @Tom_Slater_
https://t.co/k7GCOazrjy
@AlexClark3 @clarebot Moses took to removing books from shelves last night to get at a mouse. The destruction was incredible.
@AlexClark3 @samatlounge Yes. Less ‘how to rule the world in ten steps by being a bastard’ and more ‘how to be happy by giving and showing compassion’ please publishers

@AlexClark3 @talktoBOI For what little - and it’s *very* little - it is worth, I had a similar experience recently that was only resolved on fourth extended call and after repeating the same doomed-to-fail steps multiple times. One of the humans hung up at one stage but last chap stayed the course!
@AlexClark3 Thanks Alex, if you send us a DM here we will do our best to follow up on this. ^Eve

@talktoBOI Yes, I get through too. They take me through the process, and it doesn't work - as I said first, activations/approvals don't arrive on mobile, or are rejected, even when the customer service agent is generating them, or when we delete the app and re-install it etc.
@AlexClark3 Hi Alex, can I ask what happens when you call the number above and select the options provided? I have just checked the line which seems to be operating as normal. ^Eve

@AlexClark3 Hi Alex, this is the number for our support team. Or, if you call 0818365365 and select options 1, then 2, then enter your 8 digit account number, then select option 4 and this should get you in touch with an advisor who can assist you further. ^Eve
@AlexClark3 Hi Alex, thanks for your Tweet. I would advise that you contact our support team on 0818200362 and my colleagues can certainly assist you further. Thanks, Eve

@talktoBOI Hi, I'm on day 2 of trying to activate 356 online: activation/approval codes don't arrive, or fail. I have spent hours on the phone to your helpline with no success, using all my mobile minutes allowance in the process. What do you suggest?
Don’t need to click through this thread (but I did) to know almost every book is written by a man. Read & acquire more non-fiction BY WOMEN pls. https://t.co/imKYHcwmAL
Lovely, calorific birthday dinner with @fivekingdoms  and Davy. A good end to a pretty good day.
@AlexClark3 the knife!
@AlexClark3 We’ve gone largely vegetarian with the kids all away at uni, and *a certain someone* is finding dinner times in this household *very* disappointing indeed.
@AlexClark3 I assume that's how you always work.

urls.title: Afternoon tea with Jo Browning Wroe & Francis Spufford
urls.description: Join us for a splendid and legendary University Arms afternoon tea in the company  of best-selling novelists, Jo Browning Wroe and Francis Spufford and hosted by writer and broadcaster Alex Clark who will guarantee an inspiring conversation whilst you enjoy your lavish tea. A Terrible Kindness by Jo Browning Wroe tells the captivating and compassionate story of nineteen-year-old William Lavery’s  decision to volunteer at the tragic scene of the 1966 Aberfan landslide which transforms his life forever. Francis Spufford’s Light Perpetual is a tender, endlessly inventive novel that resurrects five children killed in a wartime bomb-blast and asks what kind of a future these working-class youths would have had. The signature University Arms Afternoon Tea is included and offers a delicious selection of savouries & sweets created by their chef Tristan Welch. Including freshly baked scones, served with raspberry jam, fresh strawberries and clotted cream. The only question that remains is which

tweets.text:
☕️🍰Event spotlight!🍰☕️

Join us for a decadent afternoon tea at the @University_Arms with two bestselling novelists, Francis Spufford & @JoBrowningWroe, who'll be in conversation with the brilliant @AlexClark3.

Get your tickets here: https://t.co/3TQeA7t2OO https://t.co/3w5BvtWdir

My mother, Katherine Duncan-Jones, died peacefully this morning. I was holding her hand, for which I am so grateful. This is her wooden spoon, one of my most-loved kitchen objects, and a photo of her as a teenager. And her edition of Shakespeare’s Sonnets. Xxx https://t.co/ut85Cu4OMU

@AlexClark3 We missed you!!!!

@AlexClark3 @robpalkwriter It is almost as though some people think Twitter is utter rubbish except when it's funny, and other people think something else

For the week that it’s been, it’s fitting a Donegal woman scores the goal to send Ireland women to their first ever World Cup. Our granda, a proud Creeslough man, would be looking down proud tonight. Proud of my sister, and a proud night for our family ☘️🇮🇪 💛💚 https://t.co/l18It8CqdJ

urls.title: Nick Hornby: Dickens & Prince | Events | Manchester Literature Festival
urls.description: At first glance, it seems unlikely that the white English Victorian writer Charles Dickens and the Black American musician Prince Rogers Nelson have anything in common. But as two of Nick Hornby’s ‘artists who have shaped me, inspired me, made me think about my own work’ he set out to see whether there was anything he could learn from these two great artists and their prolific bodies of work. What did they do with their phenomenal talent? Did it damage them in some way, personally, professionally? Is

tweets.text:
Nick Hornby will be @McrLitFest next week chatting to @AlexClark3 about his joyous new book Dickens & Prince, an exploration into the interesting commonalities the geniuses share. 

Have you got your ticket?https://t.co/lkrY7YKC00 https://t.co/4FgQRtWKI6
